definition: to flatten/to level/to raze to the ground
flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]

sentences.english: Somebody laid the mountains low while the town got high.
sentences.chinese: 有人把山铲平的同时，城镇越来越繁华。

sentences.english: Beijing bathhouses have all but disappeared. Will the few survivors escape the bulldozer?
sentences.chinese: 北京的澡堂子正在消失，能有几家逃脱强拆者的铲平？

sentences.english: Out of blind prejudice, the government is razing what's clearly a cultural citadel.
sentences.chinese: 政府出于盲目的偏见，意图铲平一个明显的文化堡垒。

sentences.english: A section of old Shanghai row houses is being razed.
sentences.chinese: 老上海的一部分墙壁相连的排屋正被铲平。

definition: to level/to raze to the ground
to level/to raze to the ground
to root out/to eradicate/to sweep away/to abolish
to dig into/to cut a mine into
to raze to the ground/to demolish
to cut weeds and eliminate the roots (idiom); to destroy root and branch/to eliminate completely
to kill to the last one (idiom)/to exterminate/to eradicate/ruthless
